Circumcised on the eighth day, of the people of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; in regard to the law, a Pharisee.

related_verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching.

Some of the Pharisees said, 'This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath.' But others asked, 'How can a sinner perform such signs?' So they were divided.
Yet at the same time many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they would not openly acknowledge their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue.

translation_notes: This verse highlights the respect Nicodemus had for Jesus and acknowledges that Jesus performed miracles that showed he was sent by God. I simplified the language to make it more relatable for a child.

related_verses.text: They were born, not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband’s will, but born of God.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the difference between being born as a human (which everyone experiences) and being born of the Spirit (which is a special kind of birth that allows one to understand and be part of God's kingdom). I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me comes one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Paul said, 'John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.'

translation_notes: The original Greek term 'καθαρισμοῦ' refers to 'purification,' which can mean cleansing or getting clean. For clarity, I used 'cleaning' in a way that a child might understand. The term 'ζητήσεις' means 'questions' or 'searches,' indicating the disciples were curious about something. The sentence structure was simplified to make it easier for young children to grasp the meaning.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
